title.narrative: Enhanced Displacement and Mobility Tracking and Multi-Sectoral Support for Displaced Populations in Nigeria

description.narrative: The crisis in conflict-affected north-east Nigeria remains one of the most severe in the world today, characterized by armed conflict, forced displacement and grave violations of civilians’ human rights and dignity. The overall objective of this action is to reinforce protection and resilience of displaced and conflict affected populations in Nigeria while providing an overall picture of the movements and evolving needs of displaced populations. To achieve this, IOM continues to provide information packages, conduct biometric registration and conduct assessments through its Displacement Tracking Matrix (DTM); provides site management and site improvement support, including safety audits in camps , as well as language and interpretation services for communities; enhance community engagement activities to improve social cohesion among the community members; conducts reinforcement and improvement works in shelters and distribution of reinforcement kits and non-food items to displaced populations; continues to operate the humanitarian hubs for partners to use; and implements solutions for WASH challenges to minimize public health risks; and conduct hygiene promotion activities for community members.
